summary_points: 1. On March 27, 2025, Julie A. Schertell resigned from Ingersoll Rand Inc.'s Board of Directors, Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, and Sustainability Committee.
2. The filing is an 8-K Current Report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure to the SEC.
3.  No specific future impacts or risks are explicitly mentioned in the provided excerpt.

1. Intel Corporation completed the second closing of the sale of its NAND memory technology and manufacturing business to SK hynix on March 27, 2025, receiving approximately $1.9 billion net of adjustments.
2.  The NAND wafer manufacturing and sale agreement between Intel and SK hynix, in place since December 29, 2021, terminated with the second closing.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this filing beyond the termination of the previously disclosed agreement.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$654,044,743.04 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of March 27, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On March 27, 2025, News Corp repurchased 21,366,316 Class A shares and 10,543,668 Class B shares, at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program intends to enhance shareholder value, but future repurchases are subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. On March 27, 2025, Jacobs Solutions Inc. acted as guarantor in a two-year term loan agreement with Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. for $200 million and £410 million.
2.  The agreement involved repaying a previous loan of $120,499,395.60 and £411,869,423.95 in full.

3. The interest rate on the new loan varies between a SONIA or term SOFR rate plus a margin of 0.875%–1.50% or a base rate plus 0.00%–0.50%, depending on Jacobs Engineering Group Inc.’s leverage ratio.
1. Dell Technologies Inc. issued $4,000,000,000 in senior notes with maturities ranging from 2028 to 2035, at varying interest rates and offering prices, with the closing expected on April 1, 2025.
2.  The notes were sold at a discount, with the 2035 Notes having the lowest offering price at 99.681% of their principal amount, indicating a higher yield for investors.
3. Net proceeds from the note sale will be used for general corporate purposes, which may include debt repayment,  suggesting potential future impact on the company's debt levels.
1. On March 27, 2025, T-Mobile US, Inc. closed a public offering of $3.5 billion in senior notes with varying maturity dates (2032, 2035, and 2055).
2. The net proceeds from the note sale, totaling $3.5 billion, are expected to be used for general corporate purposes, including share repurchases, dividends, and refinancing existing debt.
3.  The offering was underwritten by several firms, including Barclays Capital Inc., Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC, and UBS Securities LLC, acting as representatives.
1. VICI Properties Inc. and VICI Properties L.P. entered into an underwriting agreement on March 26, 2025, to issue and sell $1.3 billion in senior notes due 2028 and 2035.

2.  The offering is expected to generate net proceeds of approximately $1,280.7 million, with VICI LP intending to use $1,299.4 million of the proceeds to repay outstanding debt maturing in May and June 2025.

3. The offering is expected to close on April 7, 2025, subject to customary closing conditions;  any underwriters or their affiliates holding existing VICI debt will receive a portion of the net proceeds, potentially triggering FINRA Rule 5121 if over 5% of proceeds are used for such repayments.
1. On March 26, 2025, Gregory J. Hayes was elected to Becton, Dickinson and Company's Board of Directors, increasing the board size from eleven to twelve members.
2. Mr. Hayes will receive restricted stock units valued at $180,836 upon joining the board.
3.  Mr. Hayes will serve on the Audit Committee and the Compensation and Human Capital Committee.
1. On March 24, 2025, Kimberly J. Harris resigned from Ameren Corporation's Board of Directors due to personal health reasons.
2.  The SEC filing is an 8-K Current Report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in this section of the filing.
